title: Forget privacy: Here's the real reason Facebook wants encryption
text:
As Britain joins the US and Australia in pressuring Facebook into creating a ‘backdoor’ to its encrypted messaging apps, allowing law enforcement agencies access to private communication, the debate over privacy versus security has been fired yet again.

Writing in The Telegraph, home secretary Priti Patel says that companies like Facebook “should not design their platforms to create a digital blind spot where paedophiles and terrorists have free rein to conceal their crimes”.

Strong stuff. And not without its merit as examples of criminal action fuelled by encrypted messaging are clear to see.
